TopicTitle: What have you been playing recently? (Other than KSP)

Articles.Content:
ISS docking simulator.

New Page!


me when new page:

Edited June 14 by BA-Forums

My wife and I played the demo of Aska over the past 2 days, and are pretty much gonna buy it the second it comes out.

Valheim with a bit of Rimworld colony management. If it had spaceships and conveyor belts I'd probably never be heard from again.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1898300/ASKA/

Edited June 20 by Superfluous J

4 hours ago, Superfluous J said:

My wife and I played the demo of Aska over the past 2 days, and are pretty much gonna buy it the second it comes out.

Valheim with a bit of Rimworld colony management. If it had spaceships and conveyor belts I'd probably never be heard from again.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1898300/ASKA/

I like the challenge of exploration & find myself drawn to survival crafters.. but the raid mechanic of Valheim is a bit irritating.  

I use the No Raid mod when i play at home, but my buddies server is un modded and they have ashlands beat. I cannot build without getting constantly hounded. 
I know late game the new patch has minions and part of the challenge is to build fortifications, but i find myself more drawn to enshrouded.

I am wanted to Try Flight of Nova and wish Archean had support for AMD
This looks pretty bad ass, ive been trying the 3d Rim World clones like Going Mideval, Alien Dawn and Mercury Fallen.
Im going to have to check it out.

I try not to get excited about pre release EA, but star Trucker and Prison Architect 2 cant come out fast enough
 

Edited June 20 by Fizzlebop Smith

58 minutes ago, Fizzlebop Smith said:

i find myself more drawn to enshrouded

I like most everything about Enshrouded better than I do Valheim, except building. I'm hoping a revamp to building or at least a few QOL additions (like blueprinting areas and/or copy/paste) is forthcoming.
I am trying to decide on whether to get "Flight of Nova" or "Children of a Dead Earth" cany anyone weigh in and help me decide?

7 hours ago, Fizzlebop Smith said:

I am trying to decide on whether to get "Flight of Nova" or "Children of a Dead Earth" cany anyone weigh in and help me decide? 

Do you want to build or do you want to fly? Nova seems like it's trying to do Elite with better physics, CoaDE is its own very distinct and nerdy thing.

UBoat

Finally!  The game is getting ready for official release, it's on sale, and they have all the tools working in their unstable beta that I used in my Silent Hunter 3 days.

I am hunting the North Atlantic once again.  ...and I feel guilty that I didn't pay full price for this masterpiece.

6 hours ago, DDE said:

Do you want to build or do you want to fly? Nova seems like it's trying to do Elite with better physics, CoaDE is its own very distinct and nerdy thing.

I can't decide and that's the problem.

I think KSP1 had a pretty good package for things I general look for in a game. I like Elite Dangerous & think it's great but am going to try the CoDE first.

I cruised over to the forum and lurked a bit. I think having an active community around the game with a centralized place to congregate is likely what decided it.

9 hours ago, Fizzlebop Smith said:

I can't decide and that's the problem.

I think KSP1 had a pretty good package for things I general look for in a game. I like Elite Dangerous & think it's great but am going to try the CoDE first.

I cruised over to the forum and lurked a bit. I think having an active community around the game with a centralized place to congregate is likely what decided it. 

 

I played CoDE for 36 minutes, 2 years ago.  Have not touched it since.  Something about it, just didn't really sit right with me.  I'm kinda sci-fi nerdy and like the popular Star Wars, Star Trek, BSG, etc.  types of space battle.  CoDE felt like I was just installing 15 guns on the end of a Hubble space telescope.  It just wasn't that fun... and I came to the conclusion rapidly.
A lot of DRG again.  The new content in Season 5 is quite enjoyable.

I played it for a little while earlier today but it doesn't flow as well as i was hoping.. I saw the visual and can overlook that some degree. especially if there is a modding community.

The community seems rather large. (for independent geek game forum) i Imagine i will put it on the back burner and lurk in the CoDE forum for awhile before i try playing again.
It seems to have all the elements i want, so maybe it will grow on me. Definitely did not have the out the gate excitement that KSP1 did. Could be my experience with KSP has jaded me a bit to other experiences or maybe just the seasonal stuff messing with my depression.

Cant seem to find a game that gives me that feel of a major connection.  Just kinda meh in general, try a new game each weekend but so far nothing really resonates.  Onto Flight of Nova next weekend

Edited June 23 by Fizzlebop Smith

Played Little Kitty Big City today. Very short play, but very fun. I played the demo a while back, actually because @Socraticat mentioned it on this thread, so thank you for introducing me to the game!

I recently finished this old school adventure (really old school) just for the sake of the good old times.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1204710/Void_Breach/

I started to curate a custom mod build and have gotten completely side tracked by a mini game i have discovered.



I call it Label Maker - CKAN edition.

Since discovering this a little bit earlier.. I already have 6 hours in and  I must say, I think I'm addicted. 

Even once i finish the first playthrough, I anticipate a few sleepless nights over  some in game decisions that were made. I will likely continue to refine my process and create a series of "sub" labels for the game and play around with the color combining effects somewhat reminiscent of older games like alchemy.
actually nothing but wanna to play cyberpunk 77 when will have free time

PAYDAY 2

Shiroko Sunaookami simulator

Got all three of Ace Combat 7's DLC Missions. Unexpected Visitor was pretty easy. Anchorhead Raid was a pain because there's approximately one billion CIWS and AA cannons on you at any minute. Also, I'm playing these on Hard, so anti-air is actually difficult to deal with and not just a slight annoyance. I did those two missions yesterday, and today I'm going to do Ten Million Relief Plan. Wish me luck...

Edited July 1 by TwoCalories
Anchorhead Raid with the F-22 or F-35 is fun. Or Mihaly’s plane.
Oh, not much lately due to real life, but I still hammer on Skyrim (my in-game wife is Serana. I seem to like goth chicks! :D), Gran Turismo 7, a bit of Tomb Raider, and that's about it.

STAR WARS - Dark Forces Remaster.

Frontier Pilot Simulator.

7 Days to die.

KeeperRL.

Cold Waters.

ARK Survival ascended.

Avorion 2.

17 hours ago, AstroWolfie said:

Anchorhead Raid with the F-22 or F-35 is fun. Or Mihaly’s plane.

I cleared it with the F-15C + PLSL after a few tries (when I got to the shipyards I was almost immediately downed by 15 missiles and thousands of tons worth of lead in AA). The PLSL made the Mimic Squadron bossfight especially easy, too.

7 hours ago, TwoCalories said:

I cleared it with the F-15C + PLSL after a few tries (when I got to the shipyards I was almost immediately downed by 15 missiles and thousands of tons worth of lead in AA). The PLSL made the Mimic Squadron bossfight especially easy, too.

I cleared that using ADFX-01 with TLS. I have a mod that enables 13 TLSs on Morgan, so you can revive touch-and-kill TLS from games before. That helps me to kill Mimic in less than 5 minutes. 

Ten million relief plan is very hard to me, because there's about one million CIWS, SAM and AA on it and I have to get into the gun range every time I attack.

Minecraft
Thought if i set up a Bedrock server some of my fam back home would play. Guess not. May convert it to Java for Bukkit / Spiggot so i can open it up, or just go with project zomboid.
Subnautica, and swimming into caves willingly and swimming out hastily being chased by a crashfish.
